I guess i wanted to bypass the process of having to save the menu items in a hubdb table dinamically and then fetching them from somewhere else (like a completely different app), because my project is composed of two parts:
1. static content witch is served by HubSpot and is hosted on HubSpot
2. dinamic content witch is created in nextjs because of great pre-rendering and performance capabilities and is masked under HubSpot with a reverse proxy.
So that is why i need the navigation to be identical on both. User must not see the transition between basically completely different apps.
My idea was to find out if there is an api endpoint that can get me the whole menu object since the menus are set up in the navigation page in the HubSpot settings.
But nevermind that because i will end up using the hubdb as you mentioned.
Thank you :smile:

I've also used a system where I have a cron job that runs every so often and loads the time page, parses the menu and then builds that as json. Then in my non HubSpot site it reads that json for the menu and builds out. 

It would allow you to manage one menu in the native HubSpot menu, you'd just need to change the way your off HubSpot site builds the menu. Then it is a set it and forget it
